intro: Hemitelia quitensis, commonly known as the Andean bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to the cool, humid conditions of its native habitat. It has lanceolate leaves that are often covered in a fine, silvery pubescence. Hemitelia quitensis is valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated in gardens in temperate climates.
